intro: Androsace jacquemontii var. robusta, commonly known as the robust Androsace, is a low-growing alpine plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of hairy, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early summer, typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine habitats.
